text: tell us how you write almond are you
very disciplined do you have a very set

past of how discipline a very difficult

a bit about your discipline and how that
discipline plays into your writing I
just ignored a very novel is a very long
piece of work you know if you had if you
don't have that kind of sort of
organized approach to how you do it it
just never gets written you know I mean
I know people who've written who are
playwrights or screenwriters who will
often say a very different thing they
will often say that you know you think
about it and then you go and sequester
yourself and you write the thing in a
very intense brief bursts you know I
mean Noah coward famously wrote private
lives in a weakened color called a
coloration well the time yeah so but I
think there is something about these
other forms which may even benefit from
that very intense short Total Immersion
thing but you can't write a novel like
that it's just there's just it's too
long you know and so you have to I mean
I've always thought of it as that the
novel is the marathon you know which I
mean isn't it's not that marathon
runners are better athletes in sprinters
it's just there that kind of athlete
where if you don't get into a certain
rhythm and chip away the miles you know
you don't get to the end and so you have
to be temperamentally like that and what
is your own organization I just get up
in the morning of work I just do it like
a job and I think I was helped by the
fact that when I was a kid in days a

do like to do but keep I decide to stay
in the rhythm eight hours a day no I do
sometimes I mean I do allow myself to

completely come out of it you know
because I think that question of the

through and then near the final stages

with why because it's just you know work
sleep work sleep
because you see you see the end well
else's final draft and then I'm doing at

that's the most fun but it's not fun to
be around it
there was one passage if I if I may just
take a moment to read I thought it was

how it's what comes he's near the

doubly great so great that the

the grand Mughal the dusty battle weary
victorious pensive incipient Li
overweight disenchanted mustachioed

who seemed altogether too magnificent to

their sealed
earth and pickle jars about the

write that
you know one of the funny things that
I've learned in as I got older is that
the stuff that you write that people
like most is also the stuff that you
write that people like least the same

the same reason why you liked it
series or other people don't like it
this is just you know you learn late in
